name: The problem with the service lifecycle
description: One of the things that GDS is most well known for is the coining of the Agile delivery phases. But this image of services coming out of nowhere is just not true to life. Government services are very rarely completely new.

name: How the BBC Visual and Data Journalism team works with graphics in R
description: Over the past year, data journalists on the BBC Visual and Data Journalism team have fundamentally changed how they produce graphics for publication on the BBC News website.

name: Don’t feel like an expert? Share anyway.
description: Last fall, Katel LeDu and I asked more than 200 people about their experiences with professional visibility in the tech and design communities—including what was hard about it.

name: Dudes and tools
description: I wish dudes (it’s always dudes) would be as protective about #a11y, progressive enhancement (and people in general) as much as they are about their favourite tools. This feeling has been amplified 10X since I pushed https://npm-uninstall-facebook.com out.

name: A reading list for “The World-Wide Work.” — ethanmarcotte.com
description: These days, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed. The tech industry is facing a veritable raft of ethical, moral, and political crises. Automation and industrialization are reshaping our world. And sitting in the middle of all that? You and me.

name: Beyond human-centred design, to?
description: Just over a year ago I wrote a blog post called “Putting users first is not the answer to everything” — it’s been popular — in fact it’s Doteveryone’s second most read blog post, with over 6,000 reads.

name: The Web Is Agreement
description: This presentation on web standards was delivered at the State Of The Browser conference in London in September 2018.   Web standards don’t exist.

name: progression.fyi
description: progression.fyi Public and open source frameworks to help designers and engineers with personal growth. What the hell?Contribute An incredibly in-depth set of tools, blog posts and frameworks to assess engineering levels at publishing platform Medium.

name: CSS hover only where supported
description: This is super handy. You can use @media` to detect hover support, so then, your hover states won’t get “stuck” on touch/mobile. Big props to @NickColley for sharing this.

name: Tables and Beers
description: It’s end of 2018, table markup has been with us since HTML 3.2 circa 1997.

name: Our visit to the Digital Accessibility Centre for CCS Crown Marketplace
description: We have been working with the Crown Commercial Service to develop a new service for schools to find supply teachers and other agency staff. The new commercial deal helps schools get value for money and avoid fees for things like transferring temporary staff into permanent roles.

name: Don't mistake volume for confidence
description: I’ve found myself talking about anxiety recently with a few people who didn’t know I suffer with it. There’s no special reason for them not knowing. I stopped trying to hide my anxiety a good few years ago – I just don’t feel compelled to talk about it much.

name: Accessibility Cheatsheet
description: Semantic HTML helps screenreader users to understand the contents structure and gives it meaning. Ask yourself "What is it?" when writing HTML. Use a logical headline order and structuring elements as header, footer, ul, p … Every content not represented by text is invisbible for screen readers.

name: Pee and poo and the language of health
description: People come to the NHS website to get answers to their questions about health, so they need web pages that are easy to understand. The content designers who write our pages know that the words we use affect how well, and how quickly, people understand. And that affects their health.

name: Remote working – our story so far
description: Remote working can divide opinion. Advocates shout about work-life balance and greater productivity; detractors voice suspicion about duvet days or TV watching on employer time. But what’s it really like to work for a fully remote employer?  We became a virtual agency in August 2018.

name: Migrating from Jekyll+Github Pages to Hugo+Netlify
description: During the last 18 months, working on my Web site became a daunting task—be that for developing, redesigning it, writing a blog post, or making updates to my speaking and workshop pages. My then static site generator, Jekyll, is why. And a change has long been overdue...

name: Paint the Picture, Not the Frame: How Browsers Provide Everything Users Need
description: Kip Williams, professor of psychology sciences at Purdue University, conducted a fascinating experiment called “cyberball.” In his experiment, a test subject and two other participants played a computer game of catch.

name: Jameela Jamil | The 2019 MAKERS Conference
description: ANNOUNCER: Please welcome Jameela Jamil. [MUSIC PLAYING] JAMEELA JAMIL: You're going to make me cry. I get very nervous doing public speaking on my own. But hello, everyone. I hope you're well. Today I'm going to speak about men, which I know isn't necessarily the theme of the day.

name: Personal sites are awesome!
description: Personal sites are awesome, so this site was built so we can all discover each other's.  Want your site to appear on here? Go ahead and submit it on GitHub.

name: Table Design Patterns On The Web
description: Upgrade your inbox and get our editors’ picks twice a month. Tables are a design pattern for displaying large amounts of data in rows and columns, and have not yet seemed to fall out of favor, so let’s take a look at how we can create tables on the web in 2019.

name: Make it Boring
description: A good case can be made for why boring can be preferable to exciting. Read about the subprime mortgage crisis sometime, and you'll see that things got hairy because someone, somewhere, thought that investing in mortgage-backed securities should be less boring and more exciting.

name: All you need to know about whiteboard markers
description: Maybe hundreds of thousands of people are using whiteboards everyday to communicate, create and innovate. It has been too long that whiteboard markers stayed overlooked and the time has come to shed some light on these humble pawns of strategic office play.

name: mozdevs/cssremedy
description: Start your project with a remedy for the technical debt of CSS. A gift to you from Mozilla Developer Outreach. We'd love to have you contribute to this project. Create or comment on an issue.

name: Using persona profiles to test accessibility
description: In 2017, the Accessibility Team at the Government Digital Service (GDS) created accessibility personas to highlight common barriers faced by people with particular conditions and provide tips on how to design for them.

Firebreaks on GOV.UK are similar to Google’s 20% time or Spotify’s hack week. For 1 week every 3 months, teams disband and everyone is given a chance to have some self-directed time to improve GOV.UK. We’ve had 3 firebreaks now: June, September and December 2017.

name: Design Thinking
description: The myth of leadership is that it has to be top-down. The CEO has all the answers and leads by handing down mandates. But any chief who thinks he or she has all the answers is limiting the scope of the operation.

name: Sheety - Turn your Google Sheet into an API
description: Power websites, apps, or whatever you like, all from a spreadsheet. Changes to your spreadsheet update your API in realtime. Neat. First publish your Google sheet to the web by going to File > Publish to the web...

name: Design Systems Architecture Diagrams
description: So many enterprises present ecosystems far more complex than “one design system, all our products.” More and more, I’ve found discussions across groups and systems leaders challenging.

name: Content design: planning, writing and managing content
description: Alt text is used as an alternative to an image for people who use screen readers. Use alt text where you need to help users understand the visual content. Do not always make the alt text a literal description of the image: think about what point the image is making.

name: Maturing User Research
description: Last Summer I was asked to write a strategy for a second stage interview for a Head of Research role. I spent around a fortnight putting something together. I was unsuccessful (in fact, the company changed their hiring plan and didn't appoint anyone).

name: Facilitation feedback tool
description: Many of us facilitate workshops or agile habits regularly and we know if a workshop has gone well if the outcomes are useful. There are also lots of elements of facilitation that we don’t often get feedback on. So here is a tool I use to help think about and frame facilitation feedback.

name: How the GOV.UK Design System can work alongside other government design resources
description: We introduced the GOV.UK Design System with a clear goal in mind. To reduce duplication of effort and inconsistency by providing one place for teams to find the things they need to design government services. It’s been 6 months since the GOV.

name: State Of Remote Work
description: The State of Remote Work is Buffer's annual report that showcases the world of remote workers and seeks to understand them.

name: February 15th, 2019
description: Progressive enhancement. Marking up (and styling) an interactive timeline that looks good in a modern browser and still works in the first ever web browser.

name: Designing a slide deck template
description: IF’s decks begin with a title slide, followed by an index slide. We divide our decks by sections and the index slide is where you give the audience an overview of those sections: nobody likes surprises.

name: WorldWideWeb
description: Nine people came together at CERN for five days and made something amazing. I still can’t quite believe it.

name: Prioritizing “Non-Feature” Work and Continuous Improvement
description: Note: I transcribed this post from a coaching/training session. Hopefully the conversational style works OK, and it isn’t too choppy. Also, I am very sleep deprived due to the new baby! Which means I’m terrible at proofreading. But in the spirit of continuous delivery … :)

name: Checklist
description: To meet WCAG 2.0 to level AA you must be able to answer YES or Not Applicable to all of the following questions.

name: DEFRA/dst-guides
description: These guides relate to the work of Digital Service Teams (DST) in the Environment Agency who are building new Digital by default services. They cover processes, decisions, how-to's and notes.

name: API design guidance
description: Guidance on designing, building and running application programming interfaces (APIs), as well as standards for delivering the best service to users.

name: Notes from a Policy and Service Design teams workshop
description: Last week, I attended a workshop run by GDS Academy that set out to help people working in Policy and Service Design to better understand each other. It was the second of two (the first one provided insight and empathy into what it was like working in Policy, it was excellent).

name: When programming was no longer fun
description: I loved programming. I loved being able to create something out of nothing. Solving the puzzle of the program and seeing it come to life. Constantly learning new things while hours flew by, and better yet I was paid for it.  Somewhere along the line it stopped being fun.

name: The Fiction of the Data Lifecycle
description: “Data lifecycle” seems to turn up everywhere. Sometimes it’s short-hand for saying “everything done to or with data”, sometimes it gets a little diagram drawn out. And it’s mainly the little diagram that I take issue with, so that is what I shall be being opinionated about to you today.

name: Uncanny A11y
description: The pun in the title is that some people pronounce the a11y numeronym as “alley”. That makes the full title sound like uncanny valley, the concept of human-looking things seeming almost, but not quite, human and therefore creepy. In accessibility, the same thing can happen.

name: Inclusive forms: Anatomy of a (fictional) GOV.UK service
description: Last night I spoke for the first time at the London Accessibility Meetup. To those who weren’t able to make it, the talk is available on YouTube.

name: Practical Service Design
description: Demystifying Service Design — Part 1Demystifying Service Design — Part 1We are here to act in service to others. We have to be able to see how we provide and perform that service–and often we can’t.

name: Color in Design Systems
description: I’m no color expert. Far from, actually. Throughout my career, I’ve depended on visual designers better than myself to produce an engaging palette and apply it harmoniously across a UI.

name: Write on your own website
description: I’ll share two stories. I was speaking at a conference and after my talk I was approached by someone who said, “I had to think for a while, but weren’t you the one who wrote that Medium post about avoiding the word ‘just’?” Now, I’ve never written anything on Medium.

name: Introducing the Barnardo’s Design System
description: Kellie and Rich are a developer and designer at Barnardo’s building digital products that create better outcomes for more children. The two of them are building the Barnardo’s Design System to help our colleagues create their products efficiently.
